cells.data:
We examined vector ODEs of the form 

$Y' = AY$ where $A \in \mathbb{R}^{n\times n}, Y \in \mathbb{R}^{n\times 1}$

Solve for the eigen{vector,value}s of $A$ (i.e., $\{(\lambda,v) | (A - \lambda I)v = 0\}$

Then we build solutions $Y_i = e^{\lambda_i t}v_i$ and $Y = \sum_i c_i Y_i$

Then we looked at graphing based on differing initial conditions (determined by $c_1,c_2,\dots$ which forms a new coordinate space using the vectors $v_1,v_2,\dots$). We note that positive $\lambda_i$ push along $v_i$ away from the origin and negative $\lambda_i$ pull along $v_i$ towards the origin. This helps us identify the shape of the graph in different quadrants in the $C$-space.
